ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.2_0: At one time the monks from the group of six charged a monk with an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.4_0: “How could the monks from the group of six do this?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.8_0: “... Foolish men, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.10_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.11.1_0: ‘If a monk groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.8_0: not seen, not heard, not suspected.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.12_0: if he accuses him or has him accused, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.1_0: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he groundlessly charges him with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.2_0: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he groundlessly charges him with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.3_0: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he groundlessly charges him with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.4_0: If he charges someone with failure in conduct or of failure in view, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.5_0: If he charges one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.6_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.7_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.8_0: If it is to one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.3.2_0: if he accuses or has someone to be accused in accordance with his own perception;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.3.5_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on groundless, is finished.
